title: White Sands National Monument: Tent Talk
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Ranger Programs     Tent Talk                Tent Talk         NPS Photo  What do Trinity Site, mammoth tracks, Mars research, and gypsum dunes all have in common? What role does water play in the formation of gypsum, the creation of our sand dunes, and how does it preserve the existence of our dunefield? This program is an opportunity to learn, ask, and discuss the interrelationship between the creation of the gypsum dunefield and prehistoric animal tracks; learn about why this area was selected by the United States Army as the nation's first rocket test facility; and why White Sands National Monument is relevant to Mars exploration. The 20-minute informal tent talk program will vary according to each ranger and will highlight some of the lesser-known stories about the monument. When Offered daily at 11 a.m. Memorial Day through Labor Day and on weekends the rest of the year Where The tent at the Interdune Boardwalk, a 4-mile (6.44 km) drive from the fee station. Reservations Reservations are not required or permitted. Cost Program is free. Monument entrance fees apply. Program length 20 minutes Fitness The interdune boardwalk is a smooth level surface appropriate for many different fitness levels. Accessibility The tent at the Interdune Boardwalk, an elevated walkway wheelchair and stroller accessible, is approximately 0.4 mile (650m), round-trip from the parking area. Service animals are allowed at all monument facilities open to the general public. Restrooms Vaulttoilets are available at the trailhead. Seating Bench seating is provided under the tent structure. Pets Pets are allowed as long as they are non-disruptive, on a leash no longer than six feet (2 m), and are under physical control at all times. Pets, like humans, should leave only footprints. Pick up after your pet(s) and Leave No Trace. Large groups Seating is limited. Please be considerate of other park visitors. Contact us to inquire about a large group reservation. Programs may be canceled due to weather or missile range activities. Weather at the monument can vary drastically and change quickly. The decision to cancel a program due to weather is rarely made more than 30 minutes before the program start time. Call the monument at 575-479-6124 ext. 236 if you would like to confirm that a program is still scheduled. If the program is canceled, it will not be re-scheduled. Monument entrance and camping fees are non-refundable.
